message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing and machine translation. The paper also discusses the impacts of the Karaka model in NLP and dependency parsing, which are important topics in the field of computational linguistics. Additionally, the paper presents an English-Bhojpuri SMT system, which falls under the domain of machine translation. 

The paper may also belong to the sub-categories of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Learning) as it involves the use of machine learning techniques for developing the SMT system. 

Furthermore, the paper may be relevant to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as neural networks are commonly used in machine translation systems. 

Lastly, the paper may be relevant to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval) as it involves the evaluation of the SMT system, which is a common task in information retrieval.
